did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle:
A Guide to the Luray Alliance No. 316 Organization Records,
1890-1894
did.physloc: The Library Of Virginia, Local Government Records Collection, Page County
did.physdesc: 1 volume (108 p.) Volume is in poor condition due to brittle pages.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Luray Alliance No. 316 Organization Records, 1890-1894. Local Government Records Collection, Page County Court Records, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court papers from Page County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Luray Alliance No. 316 was organized in the town of Luray. It was a subgroup of the Page County Farmers' Alliance whose purpose was to promote the economic and political interests of farmers. Membership in the Luray Alliance No. 316 included men and women.

The minute book was used as an exhibit in a chancery suit, Stoneburner and Richards and others versus Page County Farmers' Alliance and others, heard in the Circuit Court of Page County during the mid-1890's.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Minute book, 1890-1894, of Luray Alliance that records the meetings of the organization's members. Information found in the minutes includes date of meetings, meeting agenda, brief summaries of committee reports and business discussions, election of individuals applying for membership, and list of members, male and female.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: For additional information see the Page County Chancery Cause, Stoneburner and Richards and others versus Page County Farmers' Alliance and others. It can be found in the Local Records Collection at the Library of Virginia. The index number is 1899-024.
